pr_title: DBZ-2167 Use legacy parser for testing purposes only

timeline.message: DBZ-2167 Use legacy parser for testing purposes only
DBZ-2167 Use legacy parser for testing purposes only

timeline.body: Ugh :) Why again do we need `TokenStream` in main? And if it's truly needed over there (and not test-only), can't we extend?
timeline.bodyText: Ugh :) Why again do we need TokenStream in main? And if it's truly needed over there (and not test-only), can't we extend?
timeline.bodyHTML: Ugh :) Why again do we need TokenStream in main? And if it's truly needed over there (and not test-only), can't we extend?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText:
It is used in TableIdParser and in Strings.
I was attemptin to do the extension first but that would need not insignificant changes including even generfication of the class which I thought is unnecessary complication. Hence I followed the path of the least resistence and made the copy so the original tokenizer is not polluted with SQL specific stuff.
replies.author: jpechane

timeline.body: How about moving the affected tests to the MySQL connector module then, so we could get rid of the Legacy parser impl altogether?
timeline.bodyText: How about moving the affected tests to the MySQL connector module then, so we could get rid of the Legacy parser impl altogether?
timeline.bodyHTML: How about moving the affected tests to the MySQL connector module then, so we could get rid of the Legacy parser impl altogether?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: @gunnarmorling Done. I am not sure if it is structurally clean but as a pragmatic solution it works.
replies.author: jpechane

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's a bit of a blurry line. But maintaining a whole parser impl only for testing seems like too much of an overhead to me. I think it's the better approach now.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.message: DBZ-2167 Remove legacy parser completely; tests depending on parser move to MySQL

timeline.body:
```suggestion
        record(23, 1, "CREATE TABLE\nperson ( name VARCHAR(22) NOT NULL );", all, t3, t2, t1);
```

One "n" too much?
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
record(23, 1, "CREATE TABLE\nnperson ( name VARCHAR(22) NOT NULL );", all, t3, t2, t1);
record(23, 1, "CREATE TABLE\nperson ( name VARCHAR(22) NOT NULL );", all, t3, t2, t1);

One "n" too much?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: ns are for free so I probably wanted to be generous with them before Christmas ;-)
replies.author: jpechane
